chapter.title: Orders
chapter.para: The Orders functions are used to pay and process orders in the system. Orders can be paid via electronic or paper services and remitted though these features. In addition, File uploads for invoices and other documents can be performed through the File upload function.

section.title: Orders Functions
section.para: The following functions are available in the Orders menu.

Local Electronic Payment
A function to allow the payment or transfer of funds electronically.
Paper Instruments
Create Cashier orders or demand drafts for the payment of invoices.
Cheque Services
Create, view the status of , or stop cheques for payment, and order new cheque books.
Remittance
Create remittances for payment of invoices.
Bill Payment
Pay Bills received from suppliers.
File Upload
Upload invoices and other documents to the .
Bulk Services
Create transaction bulks and handle transactions as a group.
Each of these functions are described in more detail in the later sections.
From this screen, you are able to access the Fund Transfer module provided by Cash Portal. You are able to transfer funds between accounts internally or to a third party electronically.
The following options are available for Local Electronic Payment

section.title: Local Electronic Payment - From Template
section.para: When creating a new Local Electronic Payment, a previously saved template can be used to pre-populate common fields of the Local Electronic Payment form. section.title: Local Electronic Payment - Retrieve Draft
section.para: This option allows a Local Electronic Payment request that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Local Electronic Payment requests that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Local Electronic Payment - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows a Local Electronic Payment request that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Local Electronic Payment requests that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

The Paper Instruments function allows funds transfer to be performed by methods other than Electronic Funds Transfer, where the Payer and the Beneficiary accounts are held by separate banks. These options allow for older methods of authorisation to be used, such as Cashier Orders, Demand Drafts and Cheques. Requests are made to the banks by the drawer, to raise the requested Paper Instruments and send them to the Beneficiary.

section.title: Remittance - From Template
section.para: When creating a new Remittance, a previously saved template can be used to pre-populate common fields of the appropriate form. Templates need to have been created at an earlier stage for them to be used (see MT103 form - Action Buttons for more information on creating templates.)

The "From Template" option allows a previously created template to be used as a basis for a Remittance. To use the template, select this option and a list of existing templates will be displayed. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Reference, Entity or Description field. To display all templates, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of templates are described as follows:
Field
Description
Reference
Template name
Entity
Entity the template is associated with.

A description of the template

icon.

section.title: Remittance - Retrieve Draft
section.para: This option allows a Remittance request that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Remittance requests that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System ID column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Remittance - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows a Remittance requests that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Remittance requests that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

The user can select to move to a new bulk by clicking the "Move to New Bulk" button. In such case a new bulk header is generated.

section.para: When creating a new Bulk Order, a previously saved template can be used to pre-populate common fields of the Bulk Order form. Templates need to have been created at an earlier stage for them to be used (see Bulk Services - From Scratch for more information on creating templates.)

The "From Template" option allows a previously created template to be used as a basis for a new Bulk Order. To use the template, select this option and a list of existing templates will be displayed. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Reference, Entity or Description field. To display all templates, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of templates are described as follows:
Field
Description
Reference
Template name
Entity
Entity the template is associated with.
Description
A description of the template

You can modify a template, by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Select a template by clicking on the Reference field of the required entry.

This option will user the same form as the from scratch option, but some fields will be pre-populated from the template. Complete or change the required fields in the rest of the form and click the Submit button at the top (or bottom) of the screen when ready.

section.para: When creating a new Bulk Services from an uploaded file, the following details are requested. As this function allows for different types of bulks to be generated, some of the fields may change depending on the type of bulks generated.

section.title: Bulk Services - Retrieve Draft
section.para: This option allows a new Bulk Order request that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of new Bulk Order requests that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Bulk Services - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows a new Bulk Order requests that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of new Bulk Order requests that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Bulk Services - Uploaded File Results
section.para: When Bulk Orders are generated from a file upload, this option allow the user to view the results of the uploaded bulks. Initially a list of bulk transactions will be displayed. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, File Type, Product group, Product Type, File Name or Upload Date From and To fields.

section.title: Pending Bulks
section.para: This function will display a list of all Bulks records that have not been approved by the bank. These can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Entity, System Id, Status, Bulk Customer Reference, CCY, Minimum and Maximum Amounts or Last Modified Dates fields.
To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

To edit the Bulk record, click on the edit button on the left of the list. Only records that have not been sent to the bank (authorised) can be edited. All other records can be reviewed only.

section.para: This function will display a list of all Bulk records that have been approved by the bank. These can be view or printed as required.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Entity, System Id, Bank Ref, Status, Bulk Customer Reference, CCY, Minimum and Maximum Amountsor Last Modified Dates fields.

section.title: Bulks Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Bulks records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.
The following options are available for Bulks Maintenance:

listitem.para: Set of functions for creating a request to initiate a product, and submitting the request to the bank.
Set of functions for creating a request to amend a product, and submitting the request to the bank.
Set of functions for creating a free-format message regarding a product, and submitting the message to the bank. In some modules this is called Update.

section.title: Bulks Maintenance - Unsigned Bulks
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Bulks transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Bulks Maintenance - Purged Bulks
section.para: List and optionally delete Bulks transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Bulks Maintenance - Rejected Bulks
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Bulks records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
